message: i recently dropped it and cracked the heck out of it, but it still works fine
Admittedly, I'm intrigued. What say you, Convorinos?
I'm curious too.  Looks interesting, but is it useful?
i love the thing personally, i started using one about 6 months ago to help with my upper back pain and its been great
@danT Yeah, I was on the fence with that as well
@kyserboy http://www.apple.com/magictrackpad/
@manima I prefer "conovores"
What is Magic Trackpad
@ericography I was thinking the same. Perhaps I'll wait to gauge value post Lion launch.

I like mine.  I don't use it all the time, but (obviously) it's very easy to grab it when I want it then put it off to the side when I don't.  I think it might be even more useful once Lion is released, given Apple's move to include more multitouch iOS-like functionality in OS X.
I like it, have been using it for a couple of months now. I think the magic mouse is just too small for my hands.
Love it...recently moved to Magic Trackpad from Mighty Mouse(Mice).  Got too used to my MBP's gestures to get used to Magic Mouse.  Think I made the right choice.
YES
I don't think I'd be able to use Lion with a mouse, so if you have a desktop/screen attached to a laptop I'd say it's a must.
I love my Apple trackpad. Really missed the trackpad from my MacBook when I switched to an iMac and a mouse. Now I'm happy again. Just wish I could have Apple trackpads for my PCs at work.

Yay. It's so enjoyable to use the magic trackpad and I've gotten pretty efficient with the multitouch gestures. They're very useful when working with lots of documents and applications. If you're used to the macbook/pro trackpad it's a must, plus it's bigger.
Nay the first 4 days using it, but yay after you get use to it.
This is how multitouch SHOULD be done!
On the macOS
I love the gestures. However, since it sits at an angle, you hand doesn't rest like it does with a MacBook trackpad. It's a love hate for me.
Yay
Undecided
Yay ... love the multi-touch + gesture ... better than on the mouse
Do you have to have a Mac or will it work on a Dell
Looks freaking awesome, I have a HP(for now) but would love this if will work on windows
Yay! Trackpad is very useful thanks to multi-touch gestures.
I'd say yay. I really like mine a lot. I use a secondary mouse for gaming but when I'm working, browsing the Net, etc. it works amazingly well.
Definitely a yay, although since the scrolling is backwards in Lion the downscroll gesture is definitely harder on the hands than it was in Snow Leopard.
I love the Trackpad. Can't stand using a mouse anymore. Just feels more natural to me.
Yay for some tasks, Nay for some. Using with Reeder is must. For graphic works using with mouse+MT both hands is an utopia. Bottom line: Wait for Lion.
